title: (x) Free font similar to Fabulous - Nocando {everyone}
content:
don't ask for free fonts here, silly. you won't get any sympathy. if indeed it is a House industries font, you can purchase it at [www.houseindustries.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050819040806/http:/www.houseindustries.com/).   
   
Here's the link to [the Las Vegas collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20050819040806/http:/houseind.com/house.php?kit=VEGAS-FO), which contains Fabulous.   
   
Oh i guess house does have some [free fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20050819040806/http:/houseind.com/house.php?page=freefonts), but Fabulous isn't one of them.
author: pablohoney77

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050819040806im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/48098.jpg)   
   
Here's Las Vegas Fabulous with the original 'F'.
Because Flatts turn out to more Hatts? :P
James, your sample is set too tight. Scripts like this should be set with the default spacing. That's why the Fl looks like an H.
Sorry! Didn't even notice that until now! Thanks. Photoshop seems to remember my previous settings even though I forget.
